meanings.definition: To make indirect reference or mention
meanings.sent1: She was alluding to her favorite book without saying its title.
meanings.sent2: The speaker kept alluding to a surprise without revealing it.
meanings.sent3: By alluding to the secret party, she made everyone curious.
meanings.sent4: His eyes alluding to a hidden sorrow, he smiled brightly.
meanings.sent5: The painting's colors alluding to a sunset created a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To hint at something without explicitly stating it
meanings.sent1: The detective was alluding to the culprit's identity during the interview.
meanings.sent2: Her smile alluded to her excitement about the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: By alluding to the surprise gift, he made her anticipate it even more.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds alluded to an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The professor's tone alluding to a difficult question made the students nervous.
